page.title: 09BENINGTON CASTLE (2)
page.content: In more recent times aÂ£Folly'was built on the mound presenting a convincing replica of a crumbling Norman court- yard. Although this is an interesting curiosity, the present main attraction to visitors lies in the beautiful gard- ens which are open to visitors on Sun- days and Wednesdays. The Lordship does not dominate the vil- lage with its presence. It lies dis- creetly behind high walls and the church, although the gates open onto the very heart of the Village Green it- self. On occasions the Village Green can be seen filled with cars and coaches visi- ting The Benington Lordship.
